headline: Easy Sugar Cookies
description: This sugar cookie recipe uses basic ingredients you probably already have on hand. They're quick and easy to make and great with candies mixed in.

video.description: See how to make this all-time favorite cookie.
video.name: Easy Sugar Cookies

name: Easy Sugar Cookies

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
Stir flour, baking soda, and baking powder together in a small bowl.

Beat sugar and butter together in a large bowl with an electric mixer until smooth. Beat in egg and vanilla. Gradually blend in flour mixture. Roll dough into walnut-sized balls and place 2 inches apart onto ungreased baking sheets.
Bake in the preheated oven until edges are golden, 8 to 10 minutes. Cool on the baking sheets briefly before removing to a wire rack to cool completely.

review.reviewBody: These were so good. At first i was scared because there‚Äôs no salt. But they have the perfect crunch. I usually don‚Äôt like sugar cookies with no frosting but these are my one exception.
These are everything I hoped for! Made brownies from a different recipe I found online last night and they were a total fail! So I am so glad this recipe went so smoothly!

Worked very well and easy! I had my 10 year old and and her 8 year old friend help make these. Similar to another reviewer, I halved it save for the egg. I also refrigerated the dough for 15 minutes then rolled it so the kids could cookie cutter hearts. They kept their shape and are delish with a raspberry reduction glaze.
It was quick and easy & cookies came out good. Could be a little more chewy, but still yummy.

I loved it.. I was a little skeptical at first but the result was amazing. And I used margarine.. I'm really excited cos this is the first cookie have made and actually love. Would be trying it again with chocolate chip or as a double chocolate chip cookie.thanksüòÅ
Kamonpornsurin
First time I made a edible cookie thank‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è

Ok, i have made other cookie recipes in the past and they have come out OK. This recipe does not work. You have to add salt and more wet ingredients. This recipe was dry and crumbly. I shaped it into walnut sized balls and put it in the oven. When I took them out they were still thick and I could barely even pick them up without them crumbling. They didn‚Äôt taste like anything. I added more salt and 4 tablespoons of butter. The things I added helped with making the dough moist and overall better. If you do end up making this recipe I recommend you add more butter, an extra egg, or more salt.

This recipe is so easy. I did look at reviews and upped the eggs to 2 per batch. I doubled the recipe. Also spooned the flour into the measure cup and leveled. I only used 5 cups of flour. I added 1 cup of brown sugar 2 cups of sugar. A teaspoon of cinnamon 1teaspoon of almond extract 1 cup of pecan chips. Only cooked it for 8 minutes. As regular sugar cookies I have no doubt the recipe will turn out delicious.
I halved this recipe (with the exception of a whole egg), mistakenly added 1 whole teaspoon of baking sodaand rolled the dough balls in sugar. Pretty good. Quick and easy recipe.

I absolutely LOVED this recipe. Are they the tastiest cookies I ever tried? Nope. But they deliver what they promise: easy & quick sugar cookies. I loved that you don‚Äôt have to change anything in the recipe for it to work. What I loved the most about this recipe is that it‚Äôs so easy and quick that my 2.5 year old can truly be part of the process!! It‚Äôs such a wonderful bonding experience. Many ‚Äúquick‚Äù recipes ask you to chill the dough for an hour, or that you add many more ingredients, or that you roll the dough in a fancy way. All of that starts being too complicated for a toddler.

Quick and easy recipe, didn't need to adjust ingredients. I would suggest rolling dough into a log, wrapping with plastic wrap, and toss it into the fridge for an hour or so to relax any gluten that may have formed while incorporating in the flour.
I loved this recipe its so tasty and savory

I didn't have baking soda so i used 3 tsps of baking powder. I also used food dye and they are perfect. It was an amazing recipe. I used my hands to mix. I wanted something quick and easy to make and this turned out nicely.

I LOVE LOVE LOVED THIS RECIPE IT WAS GREAT!!!üòÜüòÜ ü•∞ü•∞ü•∞ I didn‚Äôt have baking soda so I used 1tbsp and 1/2 tsp of baking powder I also didn‚Äôt use a mixer I used a spatula, me and my fam were craving sweets so I came to the rescue these are DELICIOUS!!! üòã Period üëèüèæ (p.s I‚Äôm 9 and love baking I will NEVER go back!!!)
I added an extra egg, it made the batter moist and the cookies less dry!
I made the recipe just the way it is no alterations. They are really good

Made this after reading a ton of reviews, made sure my butter was extremely soft and ended up with a dough that was very shaggy and requires lots of compressing with my hands to get in to balls. Once in the oven they never spread. I checked after the longest length time and they were still raw. I cooked them an additional 5 minutes to get them cooked enough but by that point they were all burned on the bottom. I won‚Äôt be making this recipe again. I consider myself a semi professional baker as far as cookies and pastries go and there isn‚Äôt enough liquid in this dough as written. It needs less flour and another egg or a tablespoon of milk to get the proper consistency. The dough is also very bland. If I were try again I would sub half the white sugar for brown, cut the flour by half a cup and add either a half an egg or tablespoon of milk. Good luck bakers!
terrible
made these into my famous scc cookies. so buttery and crisp stays chewy for days.
My kids and I have been using this recipe a lot lately. We had a little strawberry syrup and sprinkles to the mix and they turn out great. Especially if you have a sweet tooth.

Super easy recipe. I added a healthy pinch of salt which you can taste in a very subtle way. So delish! Once I started adding the dry mixture to my wet ingredients, yes it can look as if it is crumbly, I continued to beat and did the rest with a wooden spoon. The batter is so smooth and perfectly moist. I didn't need to wet my hands prior to rolling, they rolled out perfectly without leaving a sticky mess on my hands. The first batch I baked for about 9 minutes, they are crispy and moist. I like a chewy cookie so the next batch I will try at 6 1/2 minutes. Either way this is the perfect sugar cookie!
These were so easy to make and delicious. I went crazy and made a ton.. I even added a 1/2 cup of cocoa powder to one batch and they came out great. This recipe is a keeper!
These came out so delish!! I ended up adding about 1 tsp of sea salt to this recipe. My husband said these are the softest sugar cookies he‚Äôd ever had. Such a easy recipe and process üôåüèª
Cookies turned out perfect. Used the recipe exactly as it was given. Sprinkled sugar on before baking and they turned out so good.

I am loving this recipe and these are the BEST sugar cookies EVER! My daughter has egg allergy, so I have to substitute eggs by using pumpkin pur√©e. I used two tablespoons and 1 tablespoon of vanilla yogurt. She was so thrilled on how they turned out. No more expensive vegan cookies for us.
No changes we all enjoy these cookies.
Great as snack with glass of milk
These are not good. I went over the recipe a dozen times to make sure I hadn't missed something or mixed up a measurement. Nope. These are far from sweet enough.

I melted the salted butter in the microwave, added the sugar, egg, and 2 tablespoons of artificial vanilla flavoring ( because that was what I had available to use). I then added it to the premixed dry ingredients and put it in the refrigerator for 30 minutes to harden before shaping the cookie dough. What a quick and simple recipe. Very delicious. This is the best sugar cookie recipe that I have attempted. I will definitely be using this recipe again.
They came out perfect! Easiest recipe I have used.

These cookies were absolutely amazing. Perfect crisp on the outside edges but the inside was so soft. Oh so delicious. Doesn't need any icing, but it revs it up a notch when you do. Love this recipe!!
USE TWO EGGS!!! Unless you want crispy, crumbly cookies, USE TWO EGGS!!!

I love this recipe! I make these all the time! My family tells me to stop haha. If made just right, they are so soft and chewy! I usually roll mine in sugar before baking them and it makes them even better! I recommend this recipe highly!

These sugar cookies are bussin bussin! Easy enough for a baking beginner like myself, delicious enough for me to break my New Year‚Äôs resolutions. At first I thought the dough was going to be too crumbly. I slapped on some rubber gloves and gave them a mashing before rolling them in their balls to bake and the dough formed right up! Delicious. 10/10. I really haven‚Äôt had a better sugar cookie in my life. Next time I‚Äôm icing them. There will be NO MORE Crumbl cookie in my life. Period.
These turned out great,soft chewy delicious cookie
These cookies are my favorite.

YUMMY! Crisp on the outside and soft on the inside. Followed suggestions and baked for 8 minutes, came out perfect! Refridgerated for a little bit to make it a little easier to work with. If is was a little to dry I added a splash of milk - JUST a splash. Everyone loves them!
I followed the recipe exactly and it‚Äôs a keeper! Made various sugar cookies throughout the years , all similar, but I will be baking these again.
These were so good! Didn‚Äôt even use a mixer. Chewy soft excellent simple! Thank you !!!
This is my favorite cookie recipe. It‚Äôs simple to make, always tastes delicious, and is very satisfying when you crave something sweet.

Love love love this recipe... Super easy, especially for a scary baker hihihihihiii. Its simple Yet Very Tasty... The kids love it, friend love it... Even Hubby and his not into sweets... Thank you so much for the recipe..

I'm an alcoholic and I'm trying to drink less, so I started baking for something else to do. My first time making a cookie dough, and it came out great. I followed the directions, but I didn't have vanilla, and I used margarine instead of butter. I dont have a mixer, so I left 1 cup of margarine out for a couple hours to get soft, and it mixed well with a fork. The leftover dough I wrapped in plastic wrap, and put in the fridge. I Google that, should stay good a few days, and freeze if you need longer, which I won't, I'll bake the rest today or tomorrow. People complaining must not have followed the simple directions, because like I said, im new to baking and following the simple instructions came out great. My roommates liked them too, one even asked me to show him how to do it.
Easy and delicious. I can't wait to make them again!

This recipe is GREAT!!!! Although a little less flour was needed, my batch came out perfect. The dough was so perfect I could roll it out and use cookie cutters to cut my shapes perfectly!! No bad reviews on my end. Maybe you just didn't do it rightü§£ü§£ü§£

They are yummy! I added cinnamon, pecans, and almond extract and they taste like snickerdoodles. My husband loves them and so do I. I keep dipping them in my coffee. There goes my waist ü§§ Thanks Allrecipes.
This my go-to recipe for quick and delicious sugar cookies. They always turn out perfectly, sweet and moist.
I absolutely loved this recipe. I found this recipe very easy to make. Cookies turned out so chewy and delicious. 10/10 will make again. Happy baking!
Nice recipe I made tiny ones and a bigger batch I added a extra egg every other ingredient was the same as the recipe My husband loved the cookies he was happy with the outcome.
Great recipe. I did a 3rd of the recipe and I used a large ice cream scope because I wanted big cookies so that I can make a "pizookies" made popular at BJ's Brewhouse.

i love these cookies! ive been making them for a while and always forget to review! some reccomendations : dont completly melt the butter or the dough wont form well! soften it til it is soft enough to mix into the suger but not still hard! ( unsalted butter tastes the best ) make sure to seperate dry ingredients from wet ingredients or it will all be messed up! i hope these help and heres a pic of the cookies i just made!
yall this is amazing the negative reviews just haters
Made them with a half cup butter and a half cup shortening turned out great definitely a recipe I'd strongly suggest only doing if you have some sort of electric mixer though
The cookies came out perfect and they are super addictive!
I like my a little darker on the bottom so I added a couple minutes and watched them. Easy recipe and a delicious outcome.

These are pretty good! Only thing is the baking time is pretty inconsistent. I had to bake mine at 375 per recipe but for twenty minutes. Also, a tip, I noticed people saying the creaming of butter and sugar was too crumbly, and what I did to fix that/avoid it was I would beat the two then fold it to smooth out the separation with a fork. Repeat this until smooth and it works just fine. Overall good easy recipe!
I used plant butter straight out of the fridge and didn't regret it. These truly are fool proof. My 3-year old is officially in love and always wants these cookies

this recipe is amazing!!! I made these cookies over the holidays several times and got so many compliments. This recipe is perfect for parties because it makes so many cookies. 10/10 recipe love it so yassss
This is my favorite sugar cookie recipe. I don‚Äôt get the negative reviews. I follow the recipe and they turn out delicious every time.
Everyone loved them! Changed a couple of things; I used 1 cup sugar and 2 eggs
Best sugar cookies I‚Äôve ever made. No adjustments. Worked great at Denver‚Äôs higher altitude.

These are indeed Easy Sugar Cookies as their name asserts. I have made them many times, and everyone loves them. Plus, I have had some fun tinkering around with the ingredients. For one batch, I abandoned a traditional family recipe we call Santa Cookies, a shortbread cookie with crushed red and white peppermint candies mixed in that we leave out for Santa, hence the name. While my daughter loved the crushing process, this recipe had its drawbacks. Instead, this year, we used the Easy Sugar Cookies recipe, replacing ¬æ cup of the sugar with the same amount of peppermint candies (about 25 candies) powdered in a mixer instead. No one likes this loud process. However, the result was so much better, and Santa approves! Tip: I cover the top of the mixer with cling wrap before putting the lid on to contain the candy dust, and I process the candies well before I plan on using it to allow the dust to settle.
Loved the recipe but gets dry and crummy so we added 1/3 cup milk to the dough and it turned out great. Would recommend otherwise. üç™‚ù§Ô∏è #hippie4life

Soo I want to start out and say that the flavor of the cookies is absolutely amazing. As someone who doesn't like overly sweet cookies these are fantastic.i am a baked and bake professionally I'm not giving a 5 star because I do have some tweaks. I had to cut out a decent amount of flour when making these because I realized as I was adding it that it would of made the cookies overly dry. I also want to note that you have to watch these cooking. They cook longer than the specified time which is fine but they can easily be over baked too. The first tray ended up being slightly over baked but I myself don't mind a slightly crisp cookie. I wouldn't give these out to anyone though. I watched the second tray very close and caught them before they over baked but it's pretty much a matter of seconds that can make a difference. I will make again and tweak things a bit but great starting recipe

Everything about these cookies are AMAZING! I substituted the sugar for stevia they tasted great and my family loved them! Very toddler friendly, healthy, and easy! I Will definitely be making these again!
Very soft and very good
This is The sugar cookie recipe I have looked for. They are soft, & easy to make with the grandkids. Love it.

The recipe was easy. I think the bad reviews may need some explanation. So‚Ä¶ I‚Äôll start with the ‚ÄúI‚Äôm not a baker‚Äù and I was worried. I popped them in the oven and then (lol) started reading the reviews. Of course focusing on the ‚Äúbad‚Äù ones. But this is what I found out. I followed everything as spelled out above. But I think the problem could occur if one isn‚Äôt mindful of a couple things. 1) make sure your temp is 375 (NOT 350, as a lot of recipes use 350F) and 2) I started with the 8 mins but they did not look right so I did 3 more mins watching closely and checking. Still felt they were not ready so I did 3 more mins, and what VOILA! So I‚Äôm not sure if that might help somebody but those 2 things made for a decent and good cookie to give to Santa (and eat). MERRY CHRISTmas!!!! Just give it extra time but monitor them. Hope these turn out for you.

Overall, these are one of the best cookies I have ever made! They melt in your mouth the second you put them in it. My entire family gobbled them up in just a couple of days. Though, there was one little problem. I followed all of the things listed in the recipe, but the dough turned out really crumbly. I added some milk to bind it together, and it worked. But, it got really sticky, so I just put oil on my hands to make it easier to roll in balls. I didn't except it to turn out this wonderful, but it did! I can't wait to make another batch for Christmas next year! (Also, if you are using salted butter just make sure that you add a bit more sugar than you would have, so it doesn't make the cookies salty.)
These cookies come out perfect every time. Very easy to make a quick batch anytime and they are delicious!
I'm an experienced baker but these were terrible. Spread all over and burnt at minimum baking time. These were a waste of time and ingredients.

The cookies baked beautifully. But, the dough was a crumbly mess when I mixed the dry and wet ingredients together. I switched to mixing by hand with a spoon and it magically changed to regular cookie dough. (Same idea as how others say they kneaded the dough). If I use this recipe again I will experiment with less baking soda since I could taste it in the cookies. That‚Äôs why I‚Äôm only giving 3 stars. I will actually try another recipe first that doesn‚Äôt use 1/2 lb of butter. Not because I don‚Äôt like using butter, I love butter! But because right now it‚Äôs $9/lb here! I used my convection setting and the texture was perfect.

After reading some comments stating this recipe was different than previously posted I was sad. I followed all the directions added 1/2 Tablespoon of Vanilla instead of 1 tsp. Turned out just as wonderful as always!! Love these cookies!! I softened my butter in the microwave then used a mixer for all the liquid ingredients till it was smooth. After adding the dry ingredients I kneaded the dough till it was no longer flaky. Maybe that's why others are having such difficulty. Merry Christmas!!
one qestion how do i get the butter perfect like yours

I experimented with this dough and used it as a pie crust for pumpkin pie. Next time I will bake the crust first, although my family loved the texture and taste of the pie. It looked terrible to me, because the dough rose up through the filling and became a top layer. It was an interesting look but the pie was moist and yummy. I would suggest anyone wanting to try this, to bake at a lower temperature and prebake the crust about 10 minutes before adding your pie filling. I am thinking of making a cherry pie next with this crust. YUMMY
OMG!!! I made sugar cookies that look like the picture. I've tried other recipes and it never worked out. These were easy and good. Thank you!!!
Easy to make and tasty
Super delicious, very buttery. I had to add a bit of canola oil since the dough was so dry, and I used gluten free flour, but they were still delicious
Yummy cookies, dough was hard to work with because it was very crumbly - needed a lot of kneading but after that good!
I've made this three times, following the recipe as close as possible and it's turned out well every time.
Family LOVED this recipe! I rolled the balls in colored sugar sprinkles to turn them into Sparkle Cookies and they were a total hit! It was easy to follow and didn't take long to make! 5 stars!
Easy to make basic sugar cookies.
This was an amazing recipe! My only change would be to do a tablespoon of vanilla instead of a teaspoon.

These were DELICOUS. They taste exactly like the ones from the stores! I haven‚Äô t been baking for a while but these were super easy to make and the finish result was sooo good! Definitely going to make again!

These are MONEY! I tried a different recipe and regretted wasting my time and ingredients. I'll stick to this one from now on. They're so soft and chewy in the center and crispy on the edges.. perfection! Make sure you don't pack the flour when measuring it out. I sifted it and feel like that makes a difference.
This recipe can‚Äôt be correct. The dough isn‚Äôt sticking together and the balls fall apart and then don‚Äôt rise in the oven. It needs more wet ingredients or way less flour. Waste of time
this was great! my family and friends liked this as a young teen it's an easy recipe, it was really fun to make too, and a great productive thing to do with family and friends on your free time. :)
i split the recipe in half since I didn't need that many but they came out great and all my friends liked them, they were really soft and wasn't crumbly like some of the reviews say
Easiest cookies to make. I used zip loc bags for dough, rolled the dough into logs, chilled, sliced and baked. so very good. just the right crispness.

Cookies were a hit and VERY yummy. Be warned, the Cookie Dough itself is VERY crumbly. I found mixing the dough with your hands, very helpful. Use flour to roll out the dough. Not too thick, and it'll cook perfectly! Love this recipe!

I followed all of the instructions in the recipe and these sugar cookies came out perfectly. These are the best cookies I ever made. After reading the reviews I expected these to be tasteless, instead they were so sweet that I kept going back for more. Even my sister liked these and she doesn‚Äôt even like sugar cookies.
It calls for one cup of butter which is two sticks!! That‚Äôs why it wouldn‚Äôt stick together. I used margarine instead!

This recipe requires two sticks of butter! I was reading all of the negative reviews, and it appears that some others made the same mistake I did. I was adding flour and couldn‚Äôt figure out why it wasn‚Äôt coming together. I re-read the recipe and realized that I had only used one stick of butter. I softened up a second stick and used a spoon to blend it together into my mix, and it turned out perfectly and so delicious. Two sticks of butter people, that‚Äôs my best advice!
Added choco chips on top. Great. Also did crasins or dried cherrys to some. All were delish
Great sugar cookies fast & easy to make. Flavor is also great. I did add an extra teaspoon of vanilla & cut flour down to 2 1/2 cups of flour as others said it was alittle to dry.

Just finished making 4 batches. Turned out great! Learned a great idea, unfortunately too late, but will do it next time. To ensure uniform thickness, place flat, equal thickness, stirring spoons on either side of the dough, slightly narrower than the length of the rolling pin as a guide for rolling out the dough.
These cookies came out great! They are pretty easy to make and my kids loved them! I will definitely use this one again.

Just awful, no flavor - added twice as much vanilla extract and had to add extra butter because the dough was like damp sand. After cooking, they came out looking like cookies but tasted like stale cardboard.

Super simple and delicious. My hubby loved them. I did read through many of the reviews and think the advice to thoroughly beat with a mixer (2-3 minutes) and slowly combine dry with moist ingredients is key.
